#Text=Bonet de Lattes
#Text=Bonet de Lattes was a Jewish physician and astrologer .

#Text=He is known chiefly as the inventor of an astronomical ring-dial by means of which solar and stellar altitudes can be measured and the time determined with great precision by night as well as by day .
#Text=He lived in the latter part of the fifteenth century and the beginning of the sixteenth .

#Text=Originally from Provence , and belonging to a family that had its origin in Lattes near Montpellier , he was forced to leave Provence when the Jews were expelled from that land and settled in Carpentras .
#Text=From there , he went to Rome , where he became physician to Pope Alexander VI , and later to Pope Leo X .
#Text=At this time he became rabbi of the Jewish community , to which he was able to render much assistance .
#Text=He married the daughter of the physician Comprat Mossé of Aix .

#Text=Bonet described the use of his instrument in a treatise written in Carpentras , the full title of which is : Boneti de Latis , Medici Provenzalis , Annuli per eum Composti Super Astrologiæ Utilitate .
#Text=It appeared as a supplement to the Calculatio Composta in Rima de Juliano de Dati , Rome , 1493 , and was dedicated to Pope Alexander VI .
#Text=At the end , Bonet craves pardon for his bad Latin , on the score of being a Hebrew .
#Text=The treatise was republished by Jacques Lefèvre d'Étaples , together with his own commentary on John Sacrobosco 's De Sphæra Mundi and Euclid 's Geometry , Paris , 1500 .
#Text=Editions were also published in 1507 , 1521 , and 1534 .
#Text=Two editions appeared later at Marburg , in 1537 and 1557 .

#Text=In bad Latin , Bonet wrote a treatise entitled Prognosticum , published at Rome in 1498 , and dedicated to Cardinal Valentiniani and Cardinal de Borgia , in which he predicted the coming of the Messiah in the year 1505 .
#Text=A full account of the book is to be found in Abraham Farrisol 's manuscript , " Magen Abraham , " or " Wikuaḥ ha-Dat . "

#Text=A pupil of the above-mentioned Jacob Faber , Charles Bovillus ( 1470 – 1553 ) , relates in the preface to his Dialogi de Trinitate that he met Bonet de Lates in the Roman ghetto in 1507 , and went to his house in order to see the ring that he had invented .
#Text=The top part of the house was a synagogue containing the ark , hidden by a curtain , and books , lamps , and praying-scarfs .
#Text=Here , also , Bonet 's thirty-two-year-old son was discovered deeply immersed in the study of philosophy .
#Text=Toward the end of the nineteenth century , in dredging the River Tiber , a long marble slab was found with an inscription , which had probably been affixed to this house of Bonet 's .
#Text=Bovillus refers , also , to a lengthy theological argument that he had with Bonet , and he seems to imply that the son was in the end convinced of the truth of the Christian faith .

#Text=It is evidence of the position held by Bonet at the papal court that on 13 October 1513 , Reuchlin begged him to use his influence in order that the examination of the Augenspiegel should not be given into the hands of a commission made up of strangers , at all events not of Dominicans .
#Text=Further , Bonet 's intercession seems to have been successful .
#Text=Bonet is known to have had two sons .
#Text=One , Joseph , continued to remain in the papal favor ; the other , Immanuel , was also in the service of the pope , from whom he received a regular salary .
